Instruction: Combine milk and 1/4 cup sugar in a sturdy saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Combine the egg yolks and whole egg in a medium bowl. Blend 1/3 cup of sugar and cornstarch in another bowl, then add to the eggs, stirring until smooth.
Pour the hot milk into the egg mixture slowly, whisking continuously to prevent the eggs from cooking.
Bring the egg mixture back to the saucepan and heat slowly while stirring continuously until it thickens.
Remove the mixture from heat once it thickens, then blend in butter and vanilla until well combined.
Chill before serving by refrigerating the mixture with plastic wrap directly on the surface to prevent skin formation.
